meanings.sent1: The latifundio covered vast fields of crops.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy landowner owned a latifundio in the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The latifundio was so big, it took all day to walk around it!
meanings.sent4: Her latifundio was a kingdom of agriculture, ruling over the land.
meanings.sent5: The latifundio stood like a giant green carpet stretching to the horizon.

meanings.definition: The system of land ownership and agricultural production associated with large estates in Latin America
meanings.sent1: The latifundio system controlled the farming industry in the region.
meanings.sent2: Workers protested against the unfair practices of the latifundio system.
meanings.sent3: In the comedy show, they joked about the latifundio system causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The latifundio system was a tangled web of power and control.
meanings.sent5: The latifundio system loomed over the farmers like a dark cloud.
